channel.title: Daily Study Digest – Track 1 + Track 2
channel.description: Daily curated studies in behavioral science, crypto, and finance.

item.title: [Track 1] The Paradox of Choice Revisited
item.description:
Source: Journal of Experimental Psychology: General, 2024
Summary: Revisits the famous 'jam experiment' and finds that while more options attract attention, fewer choices consistently result in higher satisfaction and faster decision-making.
Why it’s notable: Strong update to a classic behavioral insight, with real-world implications for design, marketing, and productivity.

item.title: [Track 1] The Inheritance Lottery: How Family Wealth Shapes Risk-Taking and Innovation
item.description:
Source: Quarterly Journal of Economics, 2024
Summary: Uses Swedish data to show that unexpected inheritances lead to more entrepreneurship and risk-taking — but only among top wealth holders.
Why it’s notable: Sharp insight into inequality, incentive structures, and intergenerational dynamics.

item.title: [Track 2] Rollups & Data Availability: Why Scaling Isn’t Just About Throughput
item.description:
Source: Ethereum Foundation, Celestia, StarkWare blogs
Tags: [Protocol], [Core], [Interested]
Summary: Rollups bundle transactions off-chain and post results on-chain. But without guaranteed data availability, they risk censorship and unverifiable state transitions.
Why it matters: DA ensures that rollups stay decentralized and secure. It’s the backbone of Ethereum’s scalability roadmap via EIP-4844 and modular chains.
Applications: Ethereum scaling (zkSync, Optimism), modular chains (Celestia), restaking DA (EigenDA).
Related tools/projects: Celestia, Proto-Danksharding, EigenDA, RollCall

item.title: [Track 2] Latency Arbitrage and the Hidden Economics of Speed
item.description:
Source: Budish, Cramton & Shim (2015 + 2023 follow-ons)
Tags: [Market Design], [Core], [Interested]
Summary: High-frequency traders profit by reacting milliseconds faster to new data. This behavior distorts price discovery and creates a costly arms race.
Why it matters: Billions are spent on speed with no social gain. Alternatives like frequent batch auctions or speed bumps (e.g. IEX) aim to neutralize this inefficiency.
Applications: Fairer exchange design, DeFi MEV mitigation, batch settlement protocols.
Related tools/projects: IEX, CowSwap, Flashbots, Jito (Solana)
